summary:
Today's Fifty in 50 blog challenge question is:
What is the most memorable job you've held. 
Anyone who has been following this blog will know the answer to the one already (or, maybe not).  My most memorable job to date has got to have been my time in the military where I trained as an Air Traffic Controller...
title: Memorable Jobs

summary:
I used ʕ•ᴥ•ʔ Bear for blogging for a couple of months last year when I was testing out small web platforms and loved it, but what gave me pause at the time was not being able to delete images that I had upload to the media center.  I gave feedback on Herman's forum on this topic where a few of us were surprised this wasn't available right away. 
I did come back to Bear after a while since I learned about bunny...

title: Success is not an on-demand commodity

summary: A faulty software update from cybersecurity vendor Crowdstrike crippled countless Microsoft Windows computers across the globe today, disrupting everything from airline travel and financial institutions to hospitals and businesses online.  Crowdstrike said a fix has been deployed, but experts say the recovery from this outage could take some time, as Crowdstrike's solution needs to be applied manually on a per-machine basis
title: Global Microsoft Meltdown Tied to Bad Crowdstrike Update
